intro: Myosotis soleirolii, commonly known as the Italian forget-me-not, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Europe. It features delicate blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Myosotis soleirolii is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also found in wildflower meadows.
